post.description: Create a quote to check deliverability, validity and cost for delivery between two addresses.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. Either UUID or starts with `cus_`.

x-codeSamples.label: Python
x-codeSamples.source:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

import requests

url = 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/delivery_quotes'
headers = {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    'Authorization': 'Bearer {token}'
}

data = {
    "pickup_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"100 Maiden Ln\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
    "dropoff_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"30 Lincoln Center Plaza\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
    "pickup_latitude": 40.7066581,
    "pickup_longitude": -74.0071868,
    "dropoff_latitude": 38.9298375,
    "dropoff_longitude": -77.0582303,
    "pickup_phone_number": "+15555555555",
    "dropoff_phone_number": "+15555555555",
    "manifest_total_value": 1000,
    "external_store_id": "my_store_123"
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=data)

# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.

curl -X POST 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/delivery_quotes' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
-d '{
  "pickup_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"100 Maiden Ln\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "dropoff_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"30 Lincoln Center Plaza\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "pickup_latitude": 40.7066581,
  "pickup_longitude": -74.0071868,
  "dropoff_latitude": 38.9298375,
  "dropoff_longitude": -77.0582303,
  "pickup_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "dropoff_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "manifest_total_value": 1000,
  "external_store_id": "my_store_123"
  }'

post.description: Create a delivery between two addresses.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. Either UUID or starts with `cus_`.

x-codeSamples.label: Python
JavaScript
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

curl -X POST 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
-d '{
  "quote_id": "dqt_6gQ2dt31TjiOPfwux-NCXg",
  "pickup_name": "Store Name",
  "pickup_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"100 Maiden Ln\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "pickup_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "dropoff_name": "Gordon Shumway",
  "dropoff_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"30 Lincoln Center Plaza\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "dropoff_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "manifest_items": [
    {
      "name": "Bow tie",
      "quantity": 1,
      "size": "small",
      "dimensions": {
        "length": 20,
        "height": 20,
        "depth": 20
      },
      "price": 100,
      "weight": 300
    }
  ],
  "pickup_business_name": "Store Name",
  "pickup_latitude": 40.7066745,
  "pickup_longitude": -74.0071976,
  "pickup_notes": "Follow big green 'Pickup' signs in the parking lot",
  "pickup_verification": {
    "signature_requirement": {
      "enabled": true,
      "collect_signer_name": true,
      "collect_signer_relationship": true
    },
    "picture": true
  },
  "dropoff_business_name": "House of Luciano",
  "dropoff_latitude": 40.7727076,
  "dropoff_longitude": -73.9839082,
  "dropoff_notes": "Second floor, black door to the right.",
  "dropoff_seller_notes": "Fragile content - please handle the box with care during delivery.",
  "dropoff_verification": {
    "signature_requirement": {
      "enabled": true,
      "collect_signer_name": true,
      "collect_signer_relationship": true
    },
    "barcodes": [
      {
        "value": "string",
        "type": "CODE39"
      }
    ]
  },
  "deliverable_action": "deliverable_action_meet_at_door",
  "manifest_reference": "REF0000002",
  "manifest_total_value": 1000,
  "idempotency_key": "1234567890",
  "external_store_id": "my_store_123",
  "return_verification": {
    "picture": true
  },
  "external_id": "1234567890",
  "user_fees_summary": [
    "fee_type": "promo",
    "amount": -300,
    "user_fee_tax_info": [
      "tax_rate": 200
      ]
    ]
}'

get.description: List all deliveries associated with the given `customerId`

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. Either UUID or starts with `cus_`.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter deliveries by delivery state. Valid values are: “pending”, “pickup”, “pickup_complete”, “dropoff”, “delivered”, “canceled”, “returned”, and “ongoing”.

parameters.name: external_store_id
parameters.description: Filter deliveries by external_store_id.

parameters.name: start_dt
parameters.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the filter time range. If left blank, 3 months prior to the current time is used.

parameters.name: end_dt
parameters.description: (RFC 3339) End of the filter time range. If left blank, the current time is used.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of responses to return.

parameters.name: Offset
parameters.description: Offset of response objects for pagination.

post.description:
If a delivery is created with any verification requirements (e.g.: picture, signature or pincode), the resulting image file is made available to you through our proof-of-delivery endpoint. The endpoint will return a Proof-of-Delivery (P.O.D.) File – A long Base64 string that can be converted to a PNG image ([Web Converter](https://codebeautify.org/base64-to-image-converter) (External)).

The image will include the following information:
- Delivery Status
- Delivery timestamp
- Uber Order ID
- External Order ID
- Proof Type
- Image (Signature image, picture image, or pincode value)

For the `signature` verification type, signer name or signer relationship will also be included if it is enabled for a delivery.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. Either UUID or starts with `cus_`.

parameters.name: delivery_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the delivery. Always starts with del_

x-codeSamples.label: Python
JavaScript
cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
# Replace {customer_id}, {token}, and {delivery_id} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

curl -X POST 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries/{delivery_id}/proof-of-delivery' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
-d '{
      "waypoint": "dropoff",
      "type": "picture"
      }'

200.description: Returns the proof of delivery information.

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves stores that can deliver to the target location.

Scopes Needed: direct.organizations

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the organization. UUID format

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The latitude of the dropoff location.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The longitude of the dropoff location

external_id.description: Identifier for the store within the partner’s systems.

name.description: Name of the store as recorded within Uber’s systems.

pickup_address.description:
JSON string containing pickup address details.

**Note:** Please note the escaping of the quotes ( \ " ). This is not the simplest format of expression addresses, however, the benefit comes with the corresponding  parsing and accuracy  when it is received by our booking engine. Please refer to our [FAQ section](https://developer.uber.com/docs/deliveries/faq#what-are-the-address-best-practices?) for more information on how to format addresses.

dropoff_address.description:
JSON string containing dropoff address details.

**Note:** Please note the escaping of the quotes ( \ " ). This is not the simplest format of expression addresses, however, the benefit comes with the corresponding  parsing and accuracy  when it is received by our booking engine. Please refer to our [FAQ section](https://developer.uber.com/docs/deliveries/faq#what-are-the-address-best-practices?) for more information on how to format addresses.

pickup_ready_dt.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the window when an order must be picked up. Must be less than 30 days in the future.

pickup_deadline_dt.description: (RFC 3339) End of the window when an order may be picked up. Must be at least 10 mins later than pickup_ready_dt and at least 20 minutes in the future from now.

dropoff_ready_dt.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the window when an order must be dropped off. Must be less than or equal to pickup_deadline_dt.

dropoff_deadline_dt.description: (RFC 3339) End of the window when an order must be dropped off. Must be at least 20 mins later than dropoff_ready_dt and must be greater than or equal to pickup_deadline_dt.

pickup_phone_number.description: Phone number for the pickup location, usually the store's contact. This number allows the courier to call before heading to the dropoff location.

dropoff_phone_number.description: Phone number for the dropoff location, usually belonging to the end-user (recipient). This number enables the courier to make calls after en route to the dropoff and before completing the trip.

manifest_total_value.description: Value in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ) of the items in the delivery.  i.e.: $10.99 => 1099.

external_store_id.description:
Unique identifier used by our Partners to reference a store or location.

**Note:** Please be aware that if you utilize `external_store_id` in the Create Delivery process, you MUST also include this field in your Create Quote API calls.

kind.description: The type of object being described. Default: `delivery_quote`

id.description: Unique identifier for the quote (always starts with `dqt_`)

created.description: Date/Time timestamp (RFC 3339) at which the quote was created.

expires.description: Date/Time timestamp (RFC 3339) after which the quote will no longer be accepted.

fee.description: Amount in cents (¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit) that will be charged if this delivery is created.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.

currency_type.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in uppercase.

dropoff_eta.description: (RFC 3339) Estimated drop-off time. This value may exceed the request dropoff_deadline if the delivery window does not meet minimum requirements. Please validate the timestamps returned.

duration.description: Estimated minutes for this delivery to reach dropoff

pickup_duration.description: Estimated minutes until a courier will arrive at the pickup.

dropoff_deadline.description: When a delivery must be dropped off. This is the end of the dropoff window.

code.description: A coded name for the specific error (e.g., `invalid_params`, `duplicate_delivery`, `pickup_window_too_small`)

message.description: A brief description of the error (e.g., `The parameters of your request were invalid`)

code.description: A coded name for the specific error (e.g., `invalid_params`, `duplicate_delivery`, `pickup_window_too_small`)

message.description: A brief description of the error (e.g., `The parameters of your request were invalid`)

code.description: A coded name for the specific error (e.g., `invalid_params`, `duplicate_delivery`, `pickup_window_too_small`)

message.description: A brief description of the error (e.g., `The parameters of your request were invalid`)

pickup_name.description:
Designation of the location where the courier will make the pickup. This information will be visible within the courier app.

**Note:** The app will prioritize the utilization of the `pickup_business_name` if this parameter is provided.

pickup_address.description:
JSON string containing pickup address details.

**Note:** Please note the escaping of the quotes ( \ " ). This is not the simplest format of expression addresses, however, the benefit comes with the corresponding  parsing and accuracy  when it is received by our booking engine. Please refer to our [FAQ section](https://developer.uber.com/docs/deliveries/faq#what-are-the-address-best-practices?) for more information on how to format addresses.

pickup_phone_number.description: Phone number for the pickup location, usually the store's contact. This number allows the courier to call before heading to the dropoff location.

dropoff_name.description: Name of the place where the courier will make the dropoff. This information will be visible in the courier app.

dropoff_address.description:
JSON string containing dropoff address details.

**Note:** Please note the escaping of the quotes ( \ " ). This is not the simplest format of expression addresses, however, the benefit comes with the corresponding  parsing and accuracy  when it is received by our booking engine. Please refer to our [FAQ section](https://developer.uber.com/docs/deliveries/faq#what-are-the-address-best-practices?) for more information on how to format addresses.

dropoff_phone_number.description: Phone number for the dropoff location, usually belonging to the end-user (recipient). This number enables the courier to make calls after en route to the dropoff and before completing the trip.

manifest_items.description: List of items being delivered. This information will be visible in the courier app.

pickup_business_name.description: Business name of the pickup location. This information will be visible in the courier app and will override the pickup_name if provided.

pickup_notes.description: Additional instructions for the courier at the pickup location. Max 280 characters.
pickup_notes.example: Follow big green 'Pickup' signs in the parking lot

dropoff_business_name.description: Business name of the dropoff location.

dropoff_latitude.description: Dropoff latitude coordinate. This field adds precision to dropoff_address field. For example, if the dropoff address is "JFK Airport Queens, NY 11430", it would be highly recommended to use coordinates to locate the precise location of the dropoff

dropoff_longitude.description: Dropoff longitude coordinate. This field adds precision to dropoff_address field. For example, if the dropoff address is "JFK Airport Queens, NY 11430", it would be highly recommended to use coordinates to locate the precise location of the dropoff.

dropoff_notes.description: accessible after the courier accepts the trip and before heading to the dropoff location. Limited to 280 characters.
dropoff_notes.example: Second floor, black door to the right.

dropoff_seller_notes.description: Merchant's extra dropoff instructions, accessible after the courier accepts the trip and before heading to the dropoff location. Limited to 280 characters.
dropoff_seller_notes.example: Fragile content - please handle the box with care during delivery.

manifest_reference.description:
A reference identifying the manifest. Utilize this to link a delivery with relevant data in your system. This detail will be visible within the courier app.\
**Note:**
1. Please be aware that the combination of this field with `external_id` must be unique; otherwise, the delivery creation will not succeed.
2. If you can't ensure uniqueness for the manifest_reference, please include the "idempotency_key" in the request body and make sure it is unique.

manifest_total_value.description: Value in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ) of the items in the delivery.  i.e.: $10.99 => 1099.

quote_id.description: The ID of a previously generated delivery quote.

pickup_ready_dt.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the window when an order must be picked up. Must be less than 30 days in the future.

pickup_deadline_dt.description: (RFC 3339) End of the window when an order may be picked up. Must be at least 10 mins later than pickup_ready_dt and at least 20 minutes in the future from now.

dropoff_ready_dt.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the window when an order must be dropped off. Must be less than or equal to pickup_deadline_dt.

dropoff_deadline_dt.description: (RFC 3339) End of the window when an order must be dropped off. Must be at least 20 mins later than dropoff_ready_dt and must be greater than or equal to pickup_deadline_dt.

requires_dropoff_signature.description: Flag to indicate this delivery requires signature capture at dropoff.

requires_id.description: (Please use "dropoff_verification -> identification" instead). Flag to indicate this delivery requires ID check (minimum age) at dropoff.

tip.description:
Amount in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ) that will be paid to the courier as a tip. e.g.: `$5.00` => `500`.

**Note:** The fee value in the Create Delivery response includes the tip value.

idempotency_key.description: A key which is used to avoid duplicate order creation with identical idempotency keys for the same account. The key persists for a set time frame, defaulting to 60 minutes.

external_store_id.description:
Unique identifier used by our Partners to reference a store or location.

**Note:** Please be aware that if you utilize `external_store_id` in the Create Delivery process, you MUST also include this field in your Create Quote API calls.

return_notes.description: Additional instructions for the courier for return trips. Max 280 characters.
return_notes.example: Please meet store members at the counter to scan and verify the return of the order.

external_id.description: Additional reference to identify the manifest. To be used by aggregators, POS systems, and other organization structures which have an internal reference in addition to the manifest_reference used by your sub-account. Merchants can search for this value in the dashboard, and it is also visible on the billing details report generated by the dashboard.

user_fees_summary.description: A breakdown of how the order value is calculated

street_address.description: Array of street address elements. For example: ["2000 Ocean Ave", "Floor 2" ]

size.description:
Approximate size of item:
| Size | Description |
|--------|--------|
| small  | You can carry it with one hand e.g. bottle of water. |
| medium | You need a tote bag to carry it e.g. retail bag. |
| large  | You need two hands to carry it e.g. computer monitor. |
| xlarge | You need two hands to carry it e.g. 42 inch Flat Screen TV. |

**Note:** If nothing is specified, small will be applied by default.

price.description: (optional) Price in cents of unit item ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ).

vat_percentage.description: The percentage of VAT (value add tax) associated to the manifest_items. i.e.: 12.5% => 1250000.

size.description:
Approximate size of item:
| Size | Description |
|--------|--------|
| small  | You can carry it with one hand e.g. bottle of water. |
| medium | You need a tote bag to carry it e.g. retail bag. |
| large  | You need two hands to carry it e.g. computer monitor. |
| xlarge | You need two hands to carry it e.g. 42 inch Flat Screen TV. |

**Note:** If nothing is specified, small will be applied by default.

price.description: (optional) Price in cents of unit item ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ).

vat_percentage.description: The percentage of VAT (value add tax) associated to the manifest_items. i.e.: 12.5% => 1250000.

small.description: You can carry it with one hand e.g. bottle of water.

medium.description: You need a tote bag to carry it e.g. retail bag.

large.description: You need two hands to carry it e.g. computer monitor.

xlarge.description: You need two hands to carry it e.g. 42 inch Flat Screen TV.

ManifestItemDimensions.description:
Struct that contains dimensions. Please consider that `weight` is required when dimensions(`length`, `depth` and `height`) are provided.

**Note:** If both `size` and `dimensions` are provided, the `dimensions` field will take precedence. Ideally, specify only one of these fields, with `dimensions` being the preferred option to ensure clarity and accuracy.

name.description: Name of the item customization. Eg. Bun Type
Name of the customization option. Eg. Gluten Free

price.description: Price of the customization option in cents.

CustomizationOptionsTaxInfo.description: Tax information for the customization option.

tax_percentage.description: Tax percentage associated to the item customization option. i.e.: 12.5% => 1250000.

DeliverableAction.description:
Specify the action for the courier to take on a delivery.
| Name | Description |
| ---- | ----- |
| deliverable_action_meet_at_door | Meet at door delivery. This is the default if DeliverableAction is not set. |
| deliverable_action_leave_at_door | The “happy path” action for the courier to take on a delivery. When used, delivery action can be set to “leave at door” for a contactless delivery. Cannot leave at door when signature or ID verification requirements are applied when creating a delivery. Photo confirmation of delivery will be automatically applied as a requirement to complete drop-off. |

barcodes.description: Barcode values/types that must be scanned at the waypoint. Number of elements in the array is equal to the number of barcodes that must be scanned.

UpdatePickupVerificationRequirement.description: Verification steps (e.g. Barcode scanning) that must be taken before the pickup can be completed.

signature.description: Flag for if a signature is required at this waypoint. `signature_requirement` should be used instead.

barcodes.description: Barcode values/types that must be scanned at the waypoint. Number of elements in the array is equal to the number of barcodes that must be scanned.

picture.description: Flag to indicate whether a photo is mandatory at this waypoint.

PickupVerificationRequirement.description: Verification steps (e.g. Picture, Barcode scanning) that must be taken before the pickup can be completed.

barcodes.description: Barcode values/types that must be scanned at the waypoint. Number of elements in the array is equal to the number of barcodes that must be scanned.

UpdateDropoffVerificationRequest.description: Verification steps (e.g. Barcode scanning) that must be taken before the dropoff can be completed.

signature.description: Flag for if a signature is required at this waypoint.

barcodes.description: Barcode values/types that must be scanned at the waypoint. Number of elements in the array is equal to the number of barcodes that must be scanned.

picture.description: When set to true, mandates the Courier to capture an image as proof of delivery.

DropoffVerificationRequest.description: Verification steps (e.g. Picture, Barcode scanning) that must be taken before the dropoff can be completed.

signature.description: Flag for if a signature is required at this waypoint.

barcodes.description: Barcode values/types that must be scanned at the waypoint. Number of elements in the array is equal to the number of barcodes that must be scanned.

picture.description: When set to true, mandates the Courier to capture an image as proof of delivery.

DropoffVerificationResp.description: Verification steps (e.g. Picture, barcode scanning) that must be taken before the dropoff can be completed.

signature.description: Flag for if a signature is required at this waypoint.

barcodes.description: Barcode values/types that must be scanned at the waypoint. Number of elements in the array is equal to the number of barcodes that must be scanned.

picture.description: Picture captured at the return waypoint.

enabled.description: When set to true in POST requests, the delivery will require pincode entry at handoff. The pincode is internally generated and shared by Uber.

type.description: Optional - Pincode type. Defaults to default if not provided.

value.description: The value of the pincode in case merchant_provided pincode_type was provided. Otherwise it is going to be ignored. Must be a 4-digit value for the pincode.

ReturnVerificationRequirement.description: Verification steps (barcode scanning, picture, or signature) that must be taken before the return can be completed.

value.description: String value encoded in the barcode.

enabled.description: When set to true in POST requests, the delivery will require pincode entry at handoff.

value.description: The pincode that the customer must present at dropoff. The pin code is internally generated when this requirement is present and shared by Uber.

enabled.description: When set to true in POST requests, the delivery will require pincode entry at handoff. The pincode is internally generated and shared by Uber.

type.description: Optional - Pincode type. Defaults to default if not provided.

value.description: The value of the pincode in case merchant_provided pincode_type was provided. Otherwise it is going to be ignored. Must be a 4-digit value for the pincode.

min_age.description: Minimum age that must be verified for this delivery. Please refer to [Identification](https://developer.uber.com/docs/deliveries/guides/proof-of-delivery#identification) guide for more information.

no_sobriety_check.description:
A boolean flag to indicate whether a sobriety check is needed.

**Note:**
- no_sobriety_check = true (No sobriety check will be done by courier, should be used for non-alcoholic age restricted items)
- no_sobriety_check = false (sobriety check will be done by courier, must be used if delivery contains alcoholic items)

IdentificationRequirement.description: Identification scanning/verification requirements for this waypoint.

image_url.description: The URL of the signature image.

name.description: The name of the person who signed for the package.

signer_relationship.description: The relationship of the person who signed for the package to the intended recipient.

enabled.description: Flag for if a signature is required at this waypoint.

collect_signer_name.description: Flag for if the signer's name is required at this waypoint.

collect_signer_relationship.description: Flag for if the signer's relationship to the intended recipient is required at this waypoint.

SignatureRequirement.description: Signature requirement spec to indicate that a signature must be collected at this waypoint.

image_url.description: The URL of the image taken at the waypoint.

min_age_verified.description: Flag if ID was successfully verified/scanned.

value.description: String value encoded in the barcode.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the barcode was scanned or skipped

UndeliverableAction.description:
If not set then the default value is `return`

  - `leave_at_door`: Once a normal delivery attempt is made and a customer is not available. This action requests the courier to leave the package at dropoff location.

  **Note 1:** It cannot be set to `leave at door` when signature or PIN or ID verification requirements are applied when creating a delivery.

  **Note 2:** A photo confirmation of delivery will be automatically applied as a requirement to complete the dropoff.

  - `return`:  Once a normal delivery attempt is made and a customer is not available. This action requests the courier to return the package back to the pickup location.

  **Note:** Even if `deliverable_action` was set as `leave at door` and courier feels it is not okay then the package can be returned back to the pickup location.

  - `discard`: Discard option will allow the courier to keep/throw away the package if they are unable to deliver the package.

id.description: Unique identifier for the delivery (`del_` + tokenize(uuid)).

quote_id.description: ID for the Delivery Quote if one was provided when creating this delivery.

complete.description: Flag indicating if the delivery has ended, regardless of the possible end status values: `delivered`, `canceled`, `returned`.

courier_imminent.description: Flag indicating if the courier is close to the pickup or dropoff location.

created.description: Date/time at which the delivery was created.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase.

dropoff_deadline.description: When a delivery must be dropped off. This is the end of the dropoff window.

dropoff_identifier.description: This field identifies who received delivery at the dropoff location.

dropoff_ready.description: When a delivery is ready to be dropped off. This is the start of the dropoff window.

external_id.description: An ID for an account as stored in a merchant's external system.

fee.description: Amount in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ) that will be charged if this delivery is created.

kind.description: The type of object being described. Always "delivery".

live_mode.description: Flag that indicates if this is live mode or test mode.

pickup_deadline.description: When a delivery must be picked up by. This is the end of the pickup window.

pickup_eta.description: Estimated time the courier will arrive at the pickup location.

pickup_ready.description: When a delivery is ready to be picked up. This is the start of the pickup window.

status.description: The current status of the delivery. Always pending when the delivery is created.

tip.description: Amount in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ) that will be paid to the courier as a tip.

tracking_url.description: This URL can be used to track the courier during the delivery (via an unauthenticated webpage).

undeliverable_action.description:
This does not reflect the `undeliverable_action` specified in the delivery request. If a delivery was undeliverable, this field will contain the resulting action taken by the courier.
| Name | Description |
| ---- | ---- |
| "" | The delivery is not yet completed or the delivery was successful. |
| "left_at_door" | The courier left the delivery at the dropoff waypoint after failing to hand over the delivery successfully to the dropoff person. Refer the photo confirmation of the delivery through `dropoff.verification.picture`. |
| "returned" | The courier returned the delivery to the pickup waypoint after failing to complete the delivery. |

undeliverable_reason.description: If a delivery was undeliverable, this field will contain the reason why it was undeliverable, otherwise this field will remain as an empty string "". For example: `NO_SECURE_LOCATION_TO_DROPOFF`

updated.description: Date/Time at which the delivery was last updated.

uuid.description: Alternative delivery identifier. The `id` field should be used for any identification purposes. The `uuid` field is equally unique but loses contextual information - Nothing in this identifier indicates that it points to a Delivery. `uuid` is case-sensitive. Value for the `1uuid` field is UUID v4 with `-` characters removed.

batch_id.description: Unique identifier of the batch. This field will determine what orders should be batched together by store operations for courier pickup.

short_batch_id.description: The last six digits of the batch_id. This identifier can be used to indicate which packages should be grouped together for the earner at pickup

vehicle_license_plate.description: The last 4 characters of the courier's license masked license plate.

dropoff_sequence_number.description: For large batches, this will be the original dropoff sequence number in the batch. Otherwise, this will be the current index of the dropoff (or stops left).

id.description: Unique identifier for the delivery (`del_` + tokenize(uuid)).

quote_id.description: ID for the Delivery Quote if one was provided when creating this delivery.

complete.description: Flag indicating if the delivery has ended, regardless of the possible end status values: `delivered`, `canceled`, `returned`.

courier_imminent.description: Flag indicating if the courier is close to the pickup or dropoff location.

document.description: A long Base64 string representing the image.

name.description: Courier's first name and last initial.

rating.description: (DEPRECATED) Courier's rating on a scale of 1.0 to 5.0

vehicle_type.description: The type of vehicle the courier is using. Currently supports bicycle, car, van, truck, scooter, motorcycle, and walker.

phone_number.description: The courier's phone number. This is a masked phone number that can only receive calls or SMS from the dropoff phone number.

img_href.description: A URL to the courier's profile image.

name.description: Courier's first name and last initial.

rating.description: (DEPRECATED) Courier's rating on a scale of 1.0 to 5.0

vehicle_type.description: The type of vehicle the courier is using. Currently supports bicycle, car, van, truck, scooter, motorcycle, and walker.

phone_number.description: The courier's phone number. This is a masked phone number that can only receive calls or SMS from the dropoff phone number.

img_href.description: A URL to the courier's profile image.

public_phone_info.description: Information about the public phone details for the courier.

formatted_phone_number.description: The formatted phone number with the pin code.

pin_code.description: A pin code required for dialing the courier.

created_at.description: Date/Time at which the refund was created in UTC Time.

currency_code.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in uppercase.

id.description: Unique identifier of the refund request.

refund_fees.description: Array of refund fees for the refund.

refund_order_items.description: Array of refund order items for the refund.

total_partner_refund.description: Total monetary amount that the partner is liable to their customers for in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ).

total_uber_refund.description: Total monetary amount that Uber will adjust on the billing details report & invoice in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ).

category.description: The category of the refund fee. "DELIVERY" or "TAX".

fee_code.description: The fee code associated with the refund fee. "UBER_DELIVERY_FEE", "PARTNER_FEE" or "PARTNER_TAX".

value.description: The amount of the refund fee of the given category.

partner_refund_amount.description: The monetary value of items that the partner is liable towards their customers in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ).

reason.description: A predefined string of refund reason.

refund_items.description: Array of refund items for the refund.

uber_refund_amount.description: The refund amount from Uber's perspective.

name.description: Display name of the person/merchant at the waypoint.

phone_number.description: The masked phone number of the waypoint.

address.example: 2200 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, US

notes.description: Additional instructions at the waypoint location.

seller_notes.description: Delivery instructions provided by the seller for the courier at the waypoint location.

courier_notes.description: When a picture is requested as proof-of-delivery, this field contains the notes provided by the courier (e.g. where the items were left).

status.description: Delivery status in respect to the waypoint location

status_timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the status was triggered

external_store_id.description: Unique identifier used by merchants to reference a store or location.

name.description: Display name of the person/merchant at the waypoint.

phone_number.description: The masked phone number of the waypoint.

address.example: 2200 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, US

notes.description: Additional instructions at the waypoint location.

seller_notes.description: Delivery instructions provided by the seller for the courier at the waypoint location.

courier_notes.description: When a picture is requested as proof-of-delivery, this field contains the notes provided by the courier (e.g. where the items were left).

status.description: Delivery status in respect to the waypoint location

status_timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the status was triggered

external_store_id.description: Unique identifier used by merchants to reference a store or location.

name.description: Display name of the person/merchant at the waypoint.

phone_number.description: The masked phone number of the waypoint.

address.example: 2200 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94114, US

notes.description: Additional instructions at the waypoint location.

seller_notes.description: Delivery instructions provided by the seller for the courier at the waypoint location.

courier_notes.description: When a picture is requested as proof-of-delivery, this field contains the notes provided by the courier (e.g. where the items were left).

external_store_id.description: Unique identifier used by merchants to reference a store or location.

description.description: (DEPRECATED) A detailed description of what the courier will be delivering. It is better to consume the description of each item in `ManifestItem.name`.

total_value.description: Value of the items in the delivery, in local currency (as defined by the pickup location). e.g. `$10.99` => `1099` for items in the US.

relationship.description: Indicates the nature of the delivery identified in `related_deliveries`. `original` for the forward leg of the trip, and `returned` for the return leg of the trip.

dropoff_notes.description: Additional instructions for the courier at the dropoff location, accessible after the courier accepts the trip and before heading to the dropoff location. Limited to 280 characters.
dropoff_notes.example: Second floor, black door to the right.

manifest_reference.description:
A reference identifying the manifest. Utilize this to link a delivery with relevant data in your system. This detail will be visible within the courier app.\
**Note:**
1. Please be aware that the combination of this field with `external_id` must be unique; otherwise, the delivery creation will not succeed.
2. If you can't ensure uniqueness for the manifest_reference, please include the "idempotency_key" in the request body and make sure it is unique.

pickup_notes.description: Additional instructions for the courier at the pickup location. Max 280 characters.
pickup_notes.example: Follow big green 'Pickup' signs in the parking lot

requires_dropoff_signature.description: Flag to indicate this delivery requires signature capture at dropoff.

requires_id.description: (Please use "dropoff_verification -> identification" instead). Flag to indicate this delivery requires ID verification.

tip_by_customer.description: Amount in cents ( ¹/₁₀₀ of currency unit ) that will be paid to the courier as a tip.

pickup_ready_dt.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the window when an order must be picked up. Must be less than 30 days in the future.

pickup_deadline_dt.description: (RFC 3339) End of the window when an order may be picked up. Must be at least 10 mins later than pickup_ready_dt and at least 20 minutes in the future from now.

dropoff_ready_dt.description: (RFC 3339) Beginning of the window when an order must be dropped off. Must be less than or equal to pickup_deadline_dt.

dropoff_deadline_dt.description: (RFC 3339) End of the window when an order must be dropped off. Must be at least 20 mins later than dropoff_ready_dt and must be greater than or equal to pickup_deadline_dt.

waypoint.description: The waypoint where the verification requirement was taken.

type.description: The type of delivery verification requirement.

data.description: Array of deliveries matching filters (if any) provided.

next_href.description: URL for fetching next set of deliveries.

email.description: (RFC 3339) End-user's email used to create the account.

id.description: A string that represents the end-user unique device id.

DeliveryReq_external_user_info.description: End-user's information to help identify users.

fee_type.description: Specifies the type of fee to be added or subtracted. Possible values include `delivery fee`, `promo`, `loyalty points`, etc

tax_rate.description: Integer tax added to the price to get a total

customerId.name: customer_id
customerId.description: Unique identifier for the organization. Either UUID or starts with `cus_`.

deliveryId.name: delivery_id
deliveryId.description: Unique identifier for the delivery. Always starts with del_

scopes.eats.deliveries: Unique scope for Uber Direct deliveries

codeSamples.quoteCurl:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

curl -X POST 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/delivery_quotes' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
-d '{
  "pickup_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"100 Maiden Ln\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "dropoff_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"30 Lincoln Center Plaza\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "pickup_latitude": 40.7066581,
  "pickup_longitude": -74.0071868,
  "dropoff_latitude": 38.9298375,
  "dropoff_longitude": -77.0582303,
  "pickup_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "dropoff_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "manifest_total_value": 1000,
  "external_store_id": "my_store_123"
  }'
codeSamples.quotePython:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

import requests

url = 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/delivery_quotes'
headers = {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    'Authorization': 'Bearer {token}'
}

data = {
    "pickup_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"100 Maiden Ln\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
    "dropoff_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"30 Lincoln Center Plaza\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
    "pickup_latitude": 40.7066581,
    "pickup_longitude": -74.0071868,
    "dropoff_latitude": 38.9298375,
    "dropoff_longitude": -77.0582303,
    "pickup_phone_number": "+15555555555",
    "dropoff_phone_number": "+15555555555",
    "manifest_total_value": 1000,
    "external_store_id": "my_store_123"
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=data)
codeSamples.deliveryCurl:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

curl -X POST 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
-d '{
  "quote_id": "dqt_6gQ2dt31TjiOPfwux-NCXg",
  "pickup_name": "Store Name",
  "pickup_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"100 Maiden Ln\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "pickup_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "dropoff_name": "Gordon Shumway",
  "dropoff_address": "{\"street_address\":[\"30 Lincoln Center Plaza\"],\"city\":\"New York\",\"state\":\"NY\",\"zip_code\":\"10023\",\"country\":\"US\"}",
  "dropoff_phone_number": "+15555555555",
  "manifest_items": [
    {
      "name": "Bow tie",
      "quantity": 1,
      "size": "small",
      "dimensions": {
        "length": 20,
        "height": 20,
        "depth": 20
      },
      "price": 100,
      "weight": 300
    }
  ],
  "pickup_business_name": "Store Name",
  "pickup_latitude": 40.7066745,
  "pickup_longitude": -74.0071976,
  "pickup_notes": "Follow big green 'Pickup' signs in the parking lot",
  "pickup_verification": {
    "signature_requirement": {
      "enabled": true,
      "collect_signer_name": true,
      "collect_signer_relationship": true
    },
    "picture": true
  },
  "dropoff_business_name": "House of Luciano",
  "dropoff_latitude": 40.7727076,
  "dropoff_longitude": -73.9839082,
  "dropoff_notes": "Second floor, black door to the right.",
  "dropoff_seller_notes": "Fragile content - please handle the box with care during delivery.",
  "dropoff_verification": {
    "signature_requirement": {
      "enabled": true,
      "collect_signer_name": true,
      "collect_signer_relationship": true
    },
    "barcodes": [
      {
        "value": "string",
        "type": "CODE39"
      }
    ]
  },
  "deliverable_action": "deliverable_action_meet_at_door",
  "manifest_reference": "REF0000002",
  "manifest_total_value": 1000,
  "idempotency_key": "1234567890",
  "external_store_id": "my_store_123",
  "return_verification": {
    "picture": true
  },
  "external_id": "1234567890",
  "user_fees_summary": [
    "fee_type": "promo",
    "amount": -300,
    "user_fee_tax_info": [
      "tax_rate": 200
      ]
    ]
}'
codeSamples.listDeliveryCurl:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

curl -X GET 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
codeSamples.listDeliveryPython:
# Replace {customer_id} and {token} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

import requests

url = 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries'
headers = {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    'Authorization': 'Bearer {token}'
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
codeSamples.getDeliveryCurl:
# Replace {customer_id}, {token}, and {delivery_id} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

codeSamples.getDeliveryPython:
# Replace {customer_id}, {token}, and {delivery_id} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

import requests

url = 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries/{delivery_id}'
headers = {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    'Authorization': 'Bearer {token}'
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

codeSamples.cancelDeliveryPython:
# Replace {customer_id}, {token}, and {delivery_id} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

import requests

url = 'https://api.uber.com/v1/customers/{customer_id}/deliveries/{delivery_id}/cancel'
headers = {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    'Authorization': 'Bearer {token}'
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
codeSamples.podCurl:
# Replace {customer_id}, {token}, and {delivery_id} in the code block below with your specific values.
# Note that this code snippet is a sample and does not include all the fields.

-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {token}' \
-d '{
      "waypoint": "dropoff",
      "type": "picture"
      }'
